answerText: metallicity[10] Stellar metallicity is important for measuring the parameters of the nucleosynthesis process predicted by this theory. This theory, which was added to by the inflationary model, posits the universe began in a namesake explosion.
heading: NASAT  |2014 | 8 | 11 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This parameter is used to sort stars into population I, II, and III, and it appears to decrease with the age of a star. For 10 points each:  [10] Name this value, which is the proportion of a star that consists of elements other than hydrogen and helium
